actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to require hospitals receiving medicare payments for graduate medical education programs to incorporate training in disease prevention and health promotion, and to prohibit reductions in payment rates for direct and indirect medical education costs.

summary.text: Amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to require hospitals receiving payments under the Medicare program for graduate medical education programs to incorporate into such programs training in disease prevention and health promotion. Prohibits the Secretary of Health and Human Services from making any reductions in Medicare payments for direct and indirect graduate medical education costs beyond those provided in law by January 1, 1991.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to require hospitals receiving medicare payments for graduate medical education programs to incorporate training in disease prevention and health promotion, and to prohibit reductions in payment rates for direct and indirect medical education costs.
